explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 86.0-86.1degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 370mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat dermal study reported the LC50 value of >1,600mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 65mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In rabbit eye irritation tests, the treated animals exhibited a mean Draize score of 0.8 at 24 hours, and were fully recovered within 7 days (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro assays (chromosome aberration tests, reverse mutation tests and unscheduled DNA synthesis tests) and in vivo assays (mouse dominant lethal tests and unscheduled DNA synthesis tests on rat stem cells) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in carcinogenicity studies in rats, mice and dogs (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "ataxia," "hyperexcitability" and "tremors" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (year unknown)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 2 (central nervous system, liver, blood system, testis, prostate, testicular appendage)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, liver, blood system, testis, prostate, testicular appendage)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "The present substance may adversely affect the central nervous system and liver" (ICSC (1994)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies: "ataxia, increased nasal secretion, polyuria, body tremors, and coma were observed. Hematological examinations showed reductions in packed cell volume, hemoglobin, red cells, and plasma protein concentrations in blood," and "seminiferous tubular degeneration was seen" (JMPR (1998)), "changes in the prostate, seminal capsule, Cowper cyst and accessory gland" (RTECS (2006)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (prostate, testicular appendage) and Category 2 (central nervous system, testes and blood system). However, ICSC and RTECS are assigned a priority rating of 2, the effects on the prostate and testes are classified into Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.552mg/L of the fish (Carp) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5.5 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
